subject: Travel
title: Islam and the Merchant Class
description: Learn Islam and the Merchant Class in one minute.

hook.text: The Prophet Muhammad was a merchant before he was a prophet. Islam and trade grew together.

buildup.text: Muslim traders were known for fairness and contract law, which made them trusted partners.

discovery.text: As trade expanded, Islam spread from Arabia to Central Asia, Indonesia, and West Africa.

twist.text: Islam never needed missionaries on the Silk Road. Merchants were its best ambassadors.

climax.text: By 1000 AD, most Silk Road cities were majority Muslim, transforming the route's culture.

punchline.text: Commerce carried Islam farther than any conquest.

quiz.question: How did Islam primarily spread along the Silk Road?
